title: Self-Determination Theory and the Facilitation of Intrinsic Motivation
summary: Sustainable motivation requires three psychological needs to be met: Autonomy (I control this), Competence (I am good at this), and Relatedness (I am connected/supported).

effectiveness_metrics.description: Intrinsic motivation leads to longer-term adherence than extrinsic rewards (punishment/money).

mechanisms.name: Competence Feedback
mechanisms.description: Providing clear, immediate feedback that confirms mastery/progress.

mechanisms.name: Relatedness
mechanisms.description: Creating a sense of security and connection (even with a digital agent).

actionable_strategies.name: Autonomy-First Intervention
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Never force a lock-out. Always present the intervention as a choice: 'Do you want to focus now?' vs 'Force focus'.

actionable_strategies.name: Competence Visualization
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Show a 'Garden' or 'Building' that grows with every focus block, visually proving the user's capability.
